reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is not even a demo!!
Here is what you can do in this game":
- walk around
- touch rats to get 100 points (there is no "action" to catch rat; you just "touch" it)
- knock over various objects to get points

AND THAT'S IT!
You get ONE level
recommended: and that's it! Once time runs out
hoursPlayed: you can either exit to main menu or replay level.\n\nAnd even that little they managed to mess up; there are various bugs regarding clipping (you can fall off map quite easily)
voteText: objects physics don't work properly (all objects fly off in same direction
helpfulPercent: now matter from which side you push them)
votesHelpful: rat's just randomly walk around or stand still (they don't try to escape from your to give some challenge)\n\nAnd worst of all
votesTotal: THERE IS NO CATS IN THIS GAME! Only cat you see is one on main splash screen and that's it! Occasionally in game you can hear "maow" sound
commentsCount: there is no other indication that you play as cat.\n\nDon't waste your time with this POS
column16: no matter how much you like cats!\n\nP.S. Don't trust all those "positive" reviews; they are all fake and made to fool you to waste money on this!"

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nOne word 'Boring!' played 5 minutes, and im bored. May become better as it develops but at the moment there is one lvl and you knock things over, which would be more fun if there was better sound, I dont even think it has music, and when you knock something over it already has a pre-determind way that it is going to fall, so when you walk into a book to push it over it knocks you off as your in the way(most of the time) and from what ive seen there are no leaderboards or anything. Don't buy it at this time unless you have lots of faith in this game and want to get it for a cheaper price, as there is almost nothing to do. Now thanks you if you were able to read through my wall of boring text.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is broken and is in a barely pre-alpha stage, the game is full of bugs and in its current state only serves to make Early Access in general worse off than before by adding yet another poorly developed" game here.

CONS
* Broken Physics
date: all the objects only move in one direction when your "cat" collides with them in ways that make no sense
recommended: if you approach them from the wrong side the "knocked over" objects will actually fly right at you and move your character in a completely immersion-breaking way.\n\n* The level is small and ten minutes of digging on the unity store I found that most (if not all) of the level was actually bought from the Unity store under the name "Top-Down Interiors" and since this asset pack was designed with top-down levels in mind
hoursPlayed:
there is no ceiling at all despite it very clearly being a room. It is worth noting that developer isn't doing anything illegal by doing this but it would be nice to see if they had added onto the assets for a bigger and better map.

* Multiple times throughout my own personal playthroughs I found that my "cat" would fall through the floor that required a restart to play again only to fall through again.

* In its current state the game is extremely boring with the small level and lack of content beyond some books
voteText: a couple rats and cups that frequently knock your "cat" over.\n\n* The developers don't even care enough about the game to fix the skybox's black dots
helpfulPercent: an issue that is apparently easy to fix and shows how little attention to detail the developers had given to this "game".\n\nOverall I would steer clear of this game as it will most likely never leave early access in order to justify how little content and nemerous bugs are in the game. Do not buy it even on a 95% off sale."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So....we all like cats right? With Cat Simulator you get to be cat and knock stuff over! That is literally the goal of the game!

With that being said, I do have to say that the game will need a lot more work and polish, I think it has potential to be one of those off shoot fun timer waster type games that you hop in and play for a little bit to relieve some stress. But I would not buy it in it's current state.

Pros
- Interesting idea for a game, could be fun!
- You're a cat
- Low price and small download size.

Cons
- Controls need a little work, sometimes when you jump you will end up hitting an invisible wall and not go where planned.
- Only one level, since it's in early access, they will probably add more, but right now it's only one.
- Breakables don't break, I would really like the pottery to break when you knock it off :-)

I did a short video on it if you would like to watch some gameplay, I will do another video when there is an update to the game.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PmR3ASTNHJ4

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game was originally covered by me on a weekly live Game Roundup, held by The Annoying Atheist which is here (Cat Simulator starts at 54:39 : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=29YKcwRXu5U

This is a stupid idea for a game and, unsurprisingly, the game itself is stupid, and stupid in the worst sense of the term. It's one of the most boring, most unimaginative ideas and pieces of execution that I've ever played and a desperae grab especially considering it was made up of assets: https://www.assetstore.unity3d.com/en/#!/content/18139

The premise of the game is that you're a cat, you eat rats and knock over stuff and that's basically what cats do and it's the only thing they do OBVIOUSLY, because it's in a game where you need to be one with the cat so you do the thing every cat does, you eat rats and knock over everything and stack up on points. In case you couldn't tell from my description, the game gets really old, really fast. The game is also extremely buggy including the objects that you need to knock over have only one designated path to go so they can go in the direction you're coming from and maake u go flying away. There is also no skybox, as the unity asset map in the game is meant for a top down RPG, not a Cat Simulator game. You can barely climb the stairs as well, just as the cherry on top of the sh*t. The devs might argue back as one of their main promotions for this game is this -LOTS of BUGS!" That's them basically admitting that their game is f*cking sh*t. Bugs don't = a good game. Some bugs can be funny
date: but it doesn't = a better verdict.\n\nThe game looks horrible. This game has a lot of horrible textures in the map. It even looks horrible on the "Fantastic" graphics quality. I want to also bring up that I never fealt like I was a cat
recommended: it could have been called "Baby Simulator" and I wouldn't be able to tell the difference. The only thing that reminded me I was a cat was the often *meow* sound made.\n\nI hate this game even more because I can't really talk much about it because it's just a simple game "You're a cat
hoursPlayed: you knock things over" that's it. I'm finding it quite hard to justify how much I hate this game out to you
voteText:
I'm lucky I justified it this well.

Pros
+ Simple

Cons
- Boring gameplay
- Bugs
- Bad textures

Final verdict: 2/10

My curator page: http://steamcommunity.com/groups/MellowReviews"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Cat simulator is a unique game in which you play as a cat attempting to destroy everything in your path while eating rats. There are plans to expand what you can to but at the moment, those are your objectives.

Pros:
Unique Gameplay
Small dl size (Be a cat anywhere!)
Making a mess is fun
Low price

Cons:
Only one level (Game is work in progress)
A few small bugs

Overall this is an interesting game. If the devs keep up their work and add in a few more levels and maybe a leaderboards this game could be a lot of fun to play in the long run. For now I enjoying coming in every once in a while and knocking everything off the shelves, literally.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Please note: I received a free key for the explicit purpose of reviewing this game. No one associated with this game has compelled me to leave positive feedback. Observations and comments, whether positive or negative, are entirely my own.

This is a videogame. About cats. On the internet. What are you waiting for? @#$%ING GET IT ALREADY. In all seriousness, this is an Early Access game, so don't go into it expecting too much.

The graphics aren't particularly mind-blowing, but it's easy enough to distinguish between what things are. Likewise, the controls are also very, very simple: WASD for meowvement, SPACE to jump.

In terms of gameplay, there is just one goal. Players must get as meowny points as possible in two ways. The first way is to catch as many rats as possible. Each one will net you a pretty 100 points. The second way is to knock over as many things as pawsible for a measly 5 or 10 points here and there. Doing either is a lot of fun.

When it came to bugs, I didn't actually encounter all that many. I fact, to be honest, I'm not sure if most of them were bugs or intentional features.

The most notable bug" was that the rats seem to either only spawn when the game starts
date: or stop spawning at some unknown point. Either way
recommended: I ran out of things to catch. Such a shame; I could have quite happily kept meowving along and catching rats for hours.\n\nThe next bug came in the form of collision detection. At times it could be a little tricky to jump over things
hoursPlayed: or meowneuver out from behind some objects. Then there were the stairs
voteText: which I could freely pass through. I also ran into an invisible wall when I was trying to jump through what looked like a pair of large opening or "windows" on the bottom floor.\n\nLastly
votesFunny: has no roof! But that suited me fine
commentsCount: as I'm the kind of cool cat who doesn't mind staring up at the stars.\n\nThe only real complaint I have is that (at the meowment) players don't get to see a pair of cat paws swiping away at rats and books and teacups and the like. As the game is still in Early Access
column16: I hope the developers will incorporate a toggle that adds some blood and guts to the rat-slaying should players so choose. I also think that cat-napping could be a funny way to "refresh" or otherwise incorporate replenishing the timer.\n\nAll in all
column18: there is some senseless fun to be found playing this game. If you don't want to get it meow
column19: then seriously consider buying it in the future!"
